clinical_study.brief_title: Work Hour Reductions, Medical Errors, and Intern Well-Being at Providence St. Vincent Medical Center Intensive Care Unit
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Reducing ICU Interns' Work Hours on Sleep, Intern Well-Being, and Medical Errors

collaborator.agency: Providence St. Vincent Department of Medicine
Providence Center for Outcomes Research and Education

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether reducing intern work hours and eliminating extended shifts in the intensive care unit will reduce prescribing errors and improve intern well-being.

detailed_description.textblock: Each intern enrolled will complete three 4-week rotations in the intensive care unit (ICU) at Providence St. Vincent Medical Center. Each intern will complete at least one traditional schedule and one intervention schedule. The traditional schedule consists of an 80-hour work week with overnight call every third night. The longest shift on the traditional schedule is 30 hours. The intervention schedule consists of a 60-hour work week which eliminates overnight call by assigning a variety of shifts ranging from 8 to 16 hours in length.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured once a month for each intern while on ICU rotation, at least 14 days into the scheduled 28 day cycle

secondary_outcome.measure: Hours slept per night measured by actigraphy
Burnout measured by Maslach Burnout Inventory
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured once per month for each intern while on ICU rotation, at least 14 days into the 28 day rotation
Measured once per month for each intern while on ICU rotation, at least 14 days into the 28 day rotation

secondary_outcome.measure: Hours worked per shift on the traditional and intervention schedules

arm_group.description: Interns on the intervention schedule work the a modified ICU schedule averaging about 60 hours per week over 4 weeks, with maximum scheduled shift length 16 hours.
Interns on the traditional schedule work the usual ICU schedule averaging about 80 hours per week over 4 weeks, with maximum shift length 30 hours.

intervention.description: Interns on the intervention schedule work an average of 60 hours per week over 4 weeks, with maximum shift length 16 hours.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Interns rotating at Providence St. Vincent Medical Center ICU
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of narcolepsy
